required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Selenium Supplementation on Trace Mineral Antioxidant Enzyme and Amino Acid Metabolism in Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Parenteral and Enteral Selenium Supplementation on Trace Mineral Antioxidant Enzyme and Amino Acid Metabolism in Low Birth Weight Infants

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of the study were to assess the serum selenium, zinc, and copper status and plasma and white blood cell antioxidant enzyme activities of low birth weight infants receiving selenium supplemented and non-selenium supplemented parenteral nutrition from initiation of parenteral nutrition until discontinuation of preterm formula or hospital discharge.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to Discharge (~50-60 days)
primary_outcome.description: 4 timepoints include 1) baseline prior to initiation of parenteral nutrition; 2) initiation of enteral nutrition; 3) at discontinuation of parenteral nutrition; 4) at discontinuation of preterm formula/discharge

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from study day 1 to study exit (~50-60 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Weight at study day 1, at first enteral feed, at full enteral feeding, and at study exit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from study day 1 to study exit (~50-60 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Length at study day 1, at first enteral feed, at full enteral feeding, and at study exit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from study day 1 to study exit (~50-60 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Head circumference at study day 1, at first enteral feed, at full enteral feeding, and at study exit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from study day 1 to study exit (~50-60 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Daily recording of volume and calories from parenteral solutions and study formula consumed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Weight less than 1500 g at birth
- Not capable of receiving enteral feedings prior to 7 days postnatally
Exclusion Criteria:
- Metabolic abnormalities such as inborn errors of metabolism
- Current viral infections
- Enterocolitis confirmed by diagnosis
- Presence of congenital anomalies, severe cardiac disease, liver disease, severe renal and neurological diseases, cholestasis, hemolytic disease and severe gastrointestinal disease
- Evidence of chronic white blood cell disease
